Understanding the habits and needs of senior travelers
While the global travel and tourism industry is driving special programs and introducing innovative measures to attract the millennial or the new age travelers of the world, travel agencies should also keep a close watch on the traveling behavior of the senior citizens. The number of retired travelers, old couples, solo senior travelers and the likes are not at all insignificant and the travel and tourism industry should be well versed with their habits to offer the best services.
In our quest to figure out the most popular habits among the 50-plus travelers of the world, following are five interesting trends that we have come across:
When do they travel?
According to a survey done by AARP, most of the travelers above 50 years prefer domestic travel during the summer months and tries to unleash their happier sides during the weekends. They generally book a holiday with extended family members. This also focuses on the multigenerational family vacations which saw a 4% rise in 2014. Walt Disney in a report in 2014 revealed that one out of five grandparents are going on a Disney vacation with their grandchildren.
Why do they travel?
Getting away from the regular life and a short trip where the 50-plus travelers can relax are probably the main motivating factors. They travel with medicines, sunglasses and prescriptions to maximize their comfort and relaxation during these vacations.
Medical Insurance is a must!
Especially for the senior citizens, even if they are confident about their orientation while traveling, they are encouraged to buy medical travel insurance. This keeps them free from worries of probably emergency health situations.
Europe or Cruise!
The retired travelers of the world and especially the United States still prefer Europe and other tropical locations when given an option. Additionally, the cruise lines do attract an older set of travelers as well.
Seeking travel perks
Senior travelers loves to take advantage of the perks, discounts or any other facilities meant for them, especially those who are 60 and up fall under the senior category.
Are you a travel service provider working with clients who are aging gracefully? Keep a close watch on these trends and offer itineraries based on these â€“ your clients will love them and will travel to enjoy the sun and breeze with their extended family.
